author: Phil
content: Could the Orca’s mistake the boat for a shark and attack it, or other boats?

author: Doug Bostrom
content: One thing’s for sure: when we have 50,000 orca and 7.6 billion humans worldwide, the problem is not that we have too many orca.

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
Meanwhile, there’s this:

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2020/sep/13/the-tale-of-the-killer-whales

Perhaps the orca have convened an assembly, concluded that negotiation is impossible, that we’re too preoccupied with ourselves to be suitable for cohabitation?
